intro: Chaetocalyx latisiliquus, commonly known as the broad-silqued chaetocalyx, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, broad, silqued leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
